intro: Uvifera nematostachya, commonly known as the narrow-leaved uvifera, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of Asia, including China and the Himalayas, and thrives in temperate climates. The plant is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels, which is a common feature in the Apiaceae family. Uvifera nematostachya is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks.
